prompt: Create a terminal-based text editor in Python, similar to nano or a simplified vim. Implement file opening/saving, text editing, cursor navigation, and text manipulation. Make it as feature-rich and usable as you can - consider adding syntax highlighting, search/replace, undo/redo, line numbers, or other features you'd expect in a real editor. Use curses or a similar library for the terminal UI.
system_prompt: You are an expert at creating terminal applications and text editors. Build the best terminal editor you can.
evaluation_criteria: Must handle file I/O, cursor movement, text editing, and terminal UI. Evaluated on usability, features implemented, and code quality.

prompt: Create a CLI file organizer in Python that automatically organizes files in a directory by type. Implement smart categorization, preview, and undo capabilities. Make it as useful and safe as you can - consider adding dry-run mode, undo functionality, custom rules, duplicate detection, recursive directory scanning, or progress indicators. Build a tool you'd actually want to use for organizing messy directories.
system_prompt: You are an expert at building practical CLI tools with Python. Build the best file organizer you can.
evaluation_criteria: Must implement file categorization and safe operation (dry-run/preview). Evaluated on usefulness, safety features, and code quality.

prompt: Create a CLI weather dashboard in Rust. Build a beautiful terminal interface that displays weather information. For this exercise, use mock data (simulate API responses with hardcoded JSON). Make it as polished as you can - consider adding formatted tables, colors, ASCII art weather icons, multi-city support, forecasts, or other features. Focus on creating an impressive terminal UI in Rust.
system_prompt: You are an expert Rust developer who builds CLI applications. Build the best weather dashboard you can.
evaluation_criteria: Must display weather data with formatted terminal output. Evaluated on Rust code quality, UI beauty, and features.

prompt: Create a CLI Markdown to HTML converter in Node.js. Build a tool that converts Markdown files into beautiful HTML pages. Make it as feature-rich as you can - consider adding syntax highlighting, themes, custom CSS, GitHub-flavored Markdown, table of contents, or template support. Create a converter that produces professional-looking output.
system_prompt: You are an expert JavaScript/Node.js developer who builds text processing tools. Build the best Markdown converter you can.
evaluation_criteria: Must parse Markdown and generate HTML. Evaluated on parsing completeness, output quality, and features.

prompt: Create a real-time system monitoring CLI in Python with a beautiful terminal UI. Build a live dashboard showing CPU, memory, disk, processes, and network stats. Make it as impressive and useful as you can - consider adding graphs, process management, alerts, sorting, filtering, or export capabilities. Use rich/curses for the UI and psutil for system data. Create something comparable to htop or btop.
system_prompt: You are an expert at building terminal UI applications with Python. Build the best system monitor you can.
evaluation_criteria: Must display real-time system metrics with terminal UI. Evaluated on UI quality, features, and usefulness.
